website_summaries.verdict: Overwhelmingly positive feedback was given to the Brooks Glycerin 17. Those who have tried it were happy with its individual components and the overall quality of its entire existence. The luxurious underfoot experience, the agreeable in-shoe coverage, and the versatile construction were highlighted as the things that made this neutral shoe a great go-to runner.The Glycerin 17 is designed for neutral pronators and those who desire versatile footwear for speed training, asphalt adventures and gym exercises.
pros: The underfoot cushioning system of the Brooks Glycerin 17 was considered to be efficient at providing comfort throughout the running session
The inclusion of an OrthoLite® sockliner was welcomed by most testers
they believed that it enhanced the plush and pleasant platform of this neutral running shoe
Some testers stated that the in-shoe fit followed their expectations
the width profiles and the shape of the shoe accommodated the foot with ease
A couple of purchasers observed that the inner sleeve didn’t cause any irritation or discomfort to the skin
The foot-shaped platform and the well-adjusted build of this shoe helped it making it versatile
people have commented that they were able to use this shoe for activities other than running
Most of the running enthusiasts who have tried the Glycerin 17 praised the outsole unit’s capacity to grip the ground
They claimed that the ground control and steadiness were easily achieved because the rubber pad was reliably traction-ready
cons: Some purchasers didn’t like the color schemes of this road shoe, stating that the hues looked different from the more appealing online pictures

customer_reviews.title: Soft, springy and solid on the road. Road shoes suitable for light trail running too.
customer_reviews.text: These are by far most comfortable running shoes I've ever owned. My previous pair shoes were Brooks Pureconnect which served me for quiet well. Sadly it; has been discontinued and replaced with other line. Keep in mind they are half a size smaller. Other people mention it too. I should also mentioned this pair of shoes is suitable for someone who has wider feet. Shoes it's self are quiet springy and soft yet feels solid, wraps around feet like your own skin. It has enough sole thickness across all sole to support someone forefoot striking. I am forefoot striker too. I normally do 3 runs a week around 5k each run. So far I am happy with product.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas M

customer_reviews.title: Like wearing slippers with traction!
customer_reviews.text: Was unsure of fitment so used Amazon Wardrobe to order an 8 and 8.5 UK size shoe, I am normally an 8 in a regular work shoe but can be 8.5 in a trainer. As it happened the 8.5 was a perfect fit and oh so comfortable and cushioned. I have never worn a pair of trainers like them and am really looking forward now to returning to fast walking / running since a long time off. First class service from Amazon even in the Pandemic! Delivery fast and drop off at the local Post Office for returning not needed items went without a hitch. Thank you, brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, light, grippy and can be worked hard.
customer_reviews.text: Have now done about 70km in the shoes. They were comfortable straight out of the box, a bit like wearing slippers. Have discovered that you can push the shoes quite hard and they respond well. Proved to be quite grippy when I went a bit off-piste and ran/walked up to the top of Arthur’s seat in Edinburgh on a wet and misty morning. Very happy with the purchase, and they are easy to clean - no obvious signs of wear yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Michael J. Wisbey

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Great Wear
customer_reviews.text: This my 10th pair of Brooks Glycerin. Although all are different grade numbers the basic shoe is the same. It is comfortable, light weight and lasts over 800 miles/1280kmts. My feet are fine even after a 20 kilometer run. I have been running for almost 60 years and for 50 of them distance running. Brooks Glycerin are far and away the best running training shoe I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: eddiej49

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe vs my old Asics. Order a half size up though. I'm a size 9 UK shoe but ordered 9.5. Fits great and has that slightly extra bit of room to let your feet breath a little more. Zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, feel secure and great to run in
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair I've purchased. Why? Because they feel good, they're comfortable and i have less issues with my knees when running in them
customer_reviews.author: Jon Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great support and comfort
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoe, best support and comfort running shoe out there. I wore Asics before and so happy I made the switch. I’m 48 and have run 37 marathons and for me these are the most superior running shoe on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Martin P.

customer_reviews.title: Second comfortable pair
customer_reviews.text: After about 2000 miles, in my original pair which were so comfortable that I bought an identical pair, I am not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: T
customer_reviews.text: These trainers are extremely comfortable. I've owned a good few pairs of brooks Glycerin and i have always been impressed with them but these glycerin 17's are absolutely fantastic. The sock liner is so comfortable and the padding really makes it so comfy whilst also giving you huge support
customer_reviews.author: david cooper

customer_reviews.title: Best pair so far
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pair of running shoes and performed well than expected. The cushioning on the Brook Glycerin is one of the best so far and the price is more than a bargain. I'm looking forward to grab another bargain with Amazon anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Isip

customer_reviews.title: Really light, comfortable, excellent cushioning, hard wearing - all the product descriptions true
customer_reviews.text: Waited for a few months before reviewing to see how well they went. I run 5km on 4 days a week on footpaths and tracks. These are FAB. Really light, comfortable, excellent cushioning, hard wearing - all the product descriptions seem accurate, not misleading. I love these and highly recommend them, and would buy again in the future - best ones I've had.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Good cushion
customer_reviews.text: A well made and good cushion shoe ideal for long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As always, amazing quality, comfort and fit
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes I've ever run with. This is my fourth pair in a row after having run for 6 years with the previous three pairs. I've never felt pain nor have I had a running injury since using these shoes. This most recent iteration is just as enjoyable as the previous ones.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre Genest
